content.text: Find the cartesian equation corresponding to the polar equation \(r = (\sqrt{2}) \sec (\theta - \frac{1}{4}\pi)\).

Sketch the the graph of \(r = (\sqrt{2}) \sec (\theta - \frac{1}{4}\pi)\), for \(- \frac{1}{4}\pi < \theta < \frac{3}{4}\pi\), indicating clearly the polar coordinates of the intersection with the initial line.
the mean value of \(y\) with respect to \(x\) for \(0 \leqslant x \leqslant 4\),
the \(y\)-coordinate of the centroid of the region enclosed by \(C\), the line \(x = 4\) and the \(x\)-axis.

Prove by mathematical induction that, for all positive integers \(n\), \(I_{n} = \frac{n!}{2^{n + 1}}\).
